Detailed Description

The Echo Canceller Setting Interface.

LEC

The Line Echo Cancellation (LEC) is used to remove the echo caused by the delay of the telephone network line.
The tail length can be set as 2ms, 4ms, 8ms, 16ms and 32ms. The higher value of tail length requires more computation time.
The following example shows the sample code for setting the channel 0 for 2ms tail length.

Set the channel 0 for 2ms tail length for LEC: 

 
rtk_Set_echoTail(0, 2);

Line echo canceller integration flow chart

Function Documentation

int32 rtk_SetG168Lec ( uint32  chid,
uint32  support_lec,
uint32  ec_on_state 
)

Turn on or off EC (Echo Canceller)

Parameters
chidThe channel number.
ec_enableEC switch
0: Turn off EC
1: Turn on EC
ec_on_stateEC is on when
0: TDM active
1: Media active
Media acitve means that EC is on only when media (Vocoder, or VoIP session) is active.
TDM acitve means that EC is on when TDM is active. It includes the scope of media active.
In TDM acitve case, EC is on when TDM is enable, even if media(Vocoder, or VoIP session) is in-active.
Return values
0Success
int32 rtk_SetVbdEc ( uint32  chid,
uint32  vbd_high_ec_mode,
uint32  vbd_low_ec_mode,
uint32  ec_restore_val 
)

Set the Echo Canceller Mode for VBD.

Parameters
chidThe channel number.
vbd_high_ec_mode0: EC auto change is off
1: EC auto off
2: EC auto restore with NLP_mute mode
vbd_low_ec_mode0: EC auto change is off
1: EC auto off
2: EC auto restore with NLP_mute mode
ec_restore_valEC restore value for low/high VBD EC auto restore mode is enable (Available only when vbd_high_ec_mode or vbd_low_ec_mode = 2)
0: Turn off the echo canceller
1: Turn on the echo canceller
Note
VBD_high_EC_mode/ VBD_low_EC_mode
  • EC auto change is off
    Once detected the fax, the echo canceller has not changed its status.
  • EC auto off
    Once detected the fax, the echo canceller will be disabled.
  • EC auto restore with NLP_mute mode
    Once detected the fax, the echo canceller enable or disable depends on the ec_restore_val.

    Whatever the mode, the echo canceller is restored to the web pages configuration when the fax ends.
Return values
0Success
int32 rtk_SetEchoTail ( uint32  chid,
uint32  ec_select,
uint32  echo_tail,
uint32  nlp,
uint32  at_stepsize,
uint32  rt_stepsize,
uint32  cng_flag 
)

Set echo tail for LEC.

Parameters
chidThe channel number.
ec_selectSelection of EC alogrithm
0: DSP default
1: EC-32 (support 2 to 32ms echo tail length)
2: EC-128 (support 32 to 128ms echo tail length)
echo_tailThe echo tail length that is the length of time over which it can cancel echoes.
If it is set to 0 (NULL), DSP will not update the echo tail length.
Value range: 2 to 32ms for EC-32, 32 to 128ms for EC-128
Unit: ms
nlpNon-linear processor mode
0: NLP off
1: NLP_mute
2: NLP_shift
3: NLP_cng
at_stepsizeNLP Attack time stepsize
Step: 1
Resolution: 0.001
rt_stepsizeNLP Release time stepsize
Step: 1
Resolution: 0.001
cng_flagComfort noise flag
0: Turn off comfort noise in NLP mute mode
1: NLP mute mode with the comfort noise
Note
nlp
0: NLP off. Turn off NLP processing.
1: NLP_mute. Removes the nonlinear and residual part of the echo.
2: NLP_shift. To improve the voice quality when users in a specific environment are some of the voices is discontinuous.
3: NLP_cng. Not only to remove residual echo, but also generate the comfort noise.
cng_flag
The comfort noise will add the NLP processed signal when cng_flag is enabled.
This will be used only in the NLP_mute mode.
at_stepsize / rt_stepsize usage:
such as set at_stepsize=5 (in fact corresponds to a value of 0.005)
Return values
0Success
Examples:
fxo.c.
